item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to Pixflow Demo Sites. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

item.title: GLAMOROUS
item.dc:creator: asadi
item.content:encoded:
Like always, we once again prepared to follow Puddhu Bar for the current year and into 2013. We barely had the time to finish this season’s poster that the City of Torino shut down most of the Murazzi’s clubs. After an ironic “funeral”, we can only wait for the center of the Torino nightlife to come back to life once again.
“The Dreamers” drum’n bass is the city’s venue for lovers of this genre. The 2009-2010 communication was accompanied by a series of 10 anamorphisms painted in abandoned places, a reminiscence of DnB’s underground roots.

item.title: Htc New Phone With Pallax Page
item.dc:creator: asadi
item.content:encoded: What I find especially successful about this campaign is a combination of well thought-out factors. One, the casting couldn’t have been more spot on. Dean Winters—from shows like Oz and 30 Rock—really epitomizes the Mayhem persona. He wears a suit but looks like he just got out of a bar fight. He’s calm and straightforward about the destruction he causes and that matter-of-factness really hits home—especially when Winters literally hits homes. Or cars. Or motorcycles.

item.title: TOM MCRIDE
item.dc:creator: asadi
item.content:encoded: My take on this is that the speeds of the Calatrava "Brise Soleil" opening and the wind turbines are OK because, like a lot of elements in this work, they are done as if shot in time lapse.

item.title: A SHORT FILM BY BEN BRIEND
item.dc:creator: asadi
item.content:encoded: I typically dislike it when creatives use the negative to sell a product, as often times the ideas aren’t as sophisticated and rely on immature or brash imagery and tone to share a message. It can be funny, sure, but also can leave a neutral or sour taste about the brand. The Mayhem character is not a new one to the advertising world; bad guys who are stopped by the advertised product have definitely been successful in the past. It just seems that a great example of such a technique hasn’t appeared in a while.
